citation.name: Hum. Mol. Genet.
citation.title: Visual impairment and progressive phthisis bulbi caused by recessive pathogenic variant in MARK3.

comment.text: Serine/threonine-protein kinase (PubMed:23666762). Involved in the specific phosphorylation of microtubule-associated proteins for MAP2 and MAP4. Phosphorylates the microtubule-associated protein MAPT/TAU (PubMed:23666762). Phosphorylates CDC25C on 'Ser-216'. Regulates localization and activity of some histone deacetylases by mediating phosphorylation of HDAC7, promoting subsequent interaction between HDAC7 and 14-3-3 and export from the nucleus (PubMed:16980613). Negatively regulates the Hippo signaling pathway and antagonizes the phosphorylation of LATS1. Cooperates with DLG5 to inhibit the kinase activity of STK3/MST2 toward LATS1 (PubMed:28087714).
Activated by phosphorylation on Thr-211. Inhibited by phosphorylation on Thr-564.

Interacts with MAPT/TAU (PubMed:23666762). Interacts with DLG5 (via coiled-coil domain). Interacts with STK3/MST2 and STK4/MST1 in the presence of DLG5 (PubMed:28087714). Interacts with YWHAB, YWHAG, YWHAQ and YWHAZ (PubMed:16959763).
Phosphorylated at Thr-211 by STK11/LKB1 in complex with STE20-related adapter-alpha (STRADA) pseudo kinase and CAB39. Phosphorylation at Thr-564 by PRKCZ/aPKC inhibits the kinase activity.

disease.name: Visual impairment and progressive phthisis bulbi
disease.description: An autosomal recessive, progressive disease characterized by poor vision at birth and development of bilateral phthisis bulbi by adulthood.

comment.text: The disease may be caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the protein kinase superfamily. CAMK Ser/Thr protein kinase family. SNF1 subfamily.

property.value: Signaling by moderate kinase activity BRAF mutants
Signaling by high-kinase activity BRAF mutants
Signaling by BRAF and RAF fusions
Paradoxical activation of RAF signaling by kinase inactive BRAF
Expressed in cerebellar hemisphere and 227 other tissues

feature.description: Prevents phosphorylation and activation by STK11/LKB1 complex.
